title: Product X yields costs to individuals outside mkt.

content.description:
Assume that product X is produced in a perfectly competitive industry and that product X yields costs to individuals who are neither consumers nor producers of product X.

Using one correctly labeled graph, show the industry output and price under each of the following conditions.

The industry ignores the externality.

The industry produces the socially optimum level of output.

Assume that the market is producing the level of output you identified in (i).

Identify one policy the government might use to achieve the level of output you identified in (ii).
content.question: Respond to all parts of the question.

frqParts.text: Respond to all parts of the question.

unit.text: 6: Market Failure and the Role of Government

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Using economic concepts, principles, or models, explain how a specific economic outcome occurs, or what action should be taken in order to achieve a specific economic outcome.
